comments:
If I cancel a connection when prompted for a password usign SSH2, an exception 
is logged. The problem is that the cancellation results in an 
OperationCanceledException being thrown. The Jsh implementation translats this 
into a JshException which is then translated into a 
CVSAuthenticationException. Could Jsh just let the OperationCancelledException 
through

org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSAuthenticationException: 
Authentication error: com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: Auth fail
	at org.eclipse.team.ccvs.ssh2.CVSSSH2ServerConnection.open
(CVSSSH2ServerConnection.java:93)

(Connection.java:134)
	at

ection(CVSRepositoryLocation.java:131)

tion(CVSRepositoryLocation.java:336)

(Session.java:167)
	at

Update(RemoteFolderMemberFetcher.java:115)

teFolderMemberFetcher.performUpdate(FetchMembersOperation.java:68)

This problem can not be fixed without modifications to jsch.
So, I tried and have fixed this problem.
After next formal release of jsch, I will commit the code to CVS repository.

Yamanaka, please let us know when the jar file is upgraded and we can verify.
Thanks.

I'm sorry for the delay.
Today, I will release the next release after some more debug.
You will find it in 'your' next morning.
